test_questions.question: A UNION query is which of the following?
test_questions.opta: Combines the output from no more than two queries and must include the same number of columns.
test_questions.optb: Combines the output from no more than two queries and does not include the same number of columns.
test_questions.optc: Combines the output from multiple queries and must include the same number of columns.
test_questions.optd: Combines the output from multiple queries and does not include the same number of columns.

test_questions.question: Which of the following statements is true concerning subqueries?
test_questions.opta: Involves the use of an inner and outer query.
test_questions.optb: Cannot return the same result as a query that is not a subquery.
test_questions.optc: Does not start with the word SELECT.
test_questions.explanation: No answer description available for this question. Let us discuss.

test_questions.question: Which of the following is a correlated subquery?
test_questions.opta: Uses the result of an inner query to determine the processing of an outer query.
test_questions.optb: Uses the result of an outer query to determine the processing of an inner query.
test_questions.optc: Uses the result of an inner query to determine the processing of an inner query.
test_questions.optd: Uses the result of an outer query to determine the processing of an outer query.
test_questions.explanation: Correlated subquery references a column in the outer query and executes the subquery once for every row in the outer query while Uncorrelated subquery executes the subquery first and passes the value to the outer query.
